text:
Derry~Londonderry named top Halloween destination in the world
It’s official – Derry~Londonderry has been named Best Hallowe’en Destination in the World by top US publication USA Today, beating off competition from infamous spooky locations Transylvania, Sleepy Hollow and Salem, Massachusetts.
The ‘City of Bones’ scooped the majority of online votes.
Mayor of Derry City and Strabane District, Councillor Elisha McCallion, said the announcement would significantly boost the city’s reputation as a top Halloween visitor experience.
“The event is always a huge visitor attraction in terms of attracting people from all over the world to the city, and it’s a major contributor to the local economy.
“Topping the poll is an extra endorsement from the public for the fantastic programme of events which takes over the city each year, with the transformation to Scary Derry.
“What makes our celebration really special though is the involvement of the public who never fail each year to stage their own show of creepy and creative Halloween style, and who turn out to support the programme in their thousands.”
The Council’s Festivals and Events Manager Karan Leonard said: “This is a brilliant acknowledgement of all the hard work that goes into planning each year. We always strive to get the community involved through the Hallowe’en carnival workshops and by providing a diverse range of activities to suit all ages.
“There is so much local support for the event and it’s the audience participation that makes it such a success. Based on enthusiasm alone the city really does deserve the title and it will fantastic in terms of enhancing the city’s profile as an exciting visitor destination.”
